title: Denali National Park & Preserve: Prey Cycles
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Science & Research     Prey Cycles              Prey Cycles        NPS Photo / Kent Miller       Why would National Park Service biologists want to know how many snowshoe hare and willow ptarmigan are in Denali? These prey species are counted yearly to monitor the frequency and magnitude of the population cycles of each species over time. Learn more by exploring the science stories below.                 Sort By: Rating Relevance Recently Updated Title    Show 10 40  per page     Loading results...     Tags: denali prey cycles
